body_html:
@shoyer in the code, you're fetching the whole thing, right? That's not quite fair -- we should compute the length in tensorflow and return only the length back.

The current implementation indeed only returns the length back, so I think we should keep that and move forward with the doc fix suggested by this PR. Indeed, we don't want to fetch the whole thing every time update is run.
body_text:
@shoyer in the code, you're fetching the whole thing, right? That's not quite fair -- we should compute the length in tensorflow and return only the length back.

The current implementation indeed only returns the length back, so I think we should keep that and move forward with the doc fix suggested by this PR. Indeed, we don't want to fetch the whole thing every time update is run.
body:
> @shoyer in the code, you're fetching the whole thing, right? That's not quite fair -- we should compute the length in tensorflow and return only the length back.

The current implementation indeed only returns the length back, so I think we should keep that and move forward with the doc fix suggested by this PR. Indeed, we don't want to fetch the whole thing every time `update` is run.
